poem:
Title: "Cacophonous Rebellion"

Out of silence, a maestro leaps,
His baton a comet caught in a midnight dance.
Stravinsky clashes, Debussy sighs,
A riotous symphony birthed in the palms of Mäkelä.
In every discordant note, a whisper of rebellion,
Yet critics declare it a patchwork of Uncertainty.
What do they know of music's shifting sands?
The symphony thrives in each erratic measure,
In the hands of the undaunted maestro, unchained.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stravinsky: Petrushka; Debussy: Jeux; Prélude à l’Après-midi d’un Faune album review – flat and muted With three major European orchestras already in his charge, and with rumours that he is about to be named as the next chief conductor of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Klaus Mäkelä seems to have the world of orchestral music at his feet. But on the basis of the recordings that he has released so far – a distinctly patchy set". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Stravinsky: Petrushka; Debussy: Jeux; Prélude à l’Après-midi d’un Faune album review – flat and muted With three major European orchestras already in his charge, and with rumours that he is about to be named as the next chief conductor of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Klaus Mäkelä seems to have the world of orchestral music at his feet. But on the basis of the recordings that he has released so far – a distinctly patchy set
